item.title: Florida Suicides (2) - Youth Trends
item.description: Graphing the trends of suicides in Florida from 2006 to 2017 among youth between 10 and 24 years of age.

item.title: Online Courses and Textbooks
item.description: A list of learning resources that I like having on speed dial

item.title: Florida Suicides (1) - General Trends
item.description: Graphing the trends of suicides in Florida from 2006 to 2017, exploring the differences in age, gender, and race among persons 10 years and older

item.title: Florida Demographic Growth
item.description: This blogposts shows how to extract population estimates data reported by the Florida Department of Health and prepare them for analysis, specifically, for exploring the trends in demograph growth between 2006 and 2020

item.title: Managing Data Analysis with RStudio
item.description: Recent example of 1) interpreting models through graphs rather than parameters 2) using self-contains RMarkdown notebook vs .R + .Rmd split

item.title: Managing Data Analysis with RStudio
item.description: The workshop introduces R and RStudio and makes the case for project-oriented workflows for applied data analysis. Using logistic regression on Titanic data as an example, the participants will learn to communicate statistical findings more effectively, and will evaluate the advantages of using computational notebooks in RStudio to disseminate the results

item.title: Implementing Reproducible Visualizations
item.description: Visualising results of statistical modeling is a key component of data science workflow. Statistical graphs often is the best means to explain and promote research findings. However,in order to find that one graph that tells the story worth sharing, we sometimes have to try out and sift through many data visualizations. How should we approach such a task? What can we do to make it easier from both production and evaluation perspectives?

item.title: What Lies Beyond Acute Care Data
item.description: Using service utilization data of 4,067 residents of Vancouver Island with sever alcohol addiction we demonstrate the cross-continuum terrain of health services in Vancouver Island Health Authority.

item.title: Transactional Data of Island Health
item.description: Describing the application of Clinical Context Coding Scheme to stratification of Mental Health and Substance Use services on Vancouver Island from 2007 to 2017

item.title: Visualizing Logistic Regression
item.description: Visualising results of statistical modeling is a key component of data science workflow. Statistical graphs are often the best means to explain and promote research findings. However, in order to find that one graph that tells the story worth sharing, we sometimes have to try out and sift through many data visualizations. How should we approach such a task? What can we do to make it easier from both production and evaluation perspectives?

item.title: When notebooks are not enough
item.description: Abstract While computational notebooks offer scientists and engineers many helpful features, the limitations of this medium make it but a starting point in creating software - the practical goal of data science. Where do we go from computational notebooks if our projects require multiple interconnected scripts and dynamic documents? How do we ensure reproducibility amidst growing complexity of analyses and operations? I will use a concrete analytical example to demonstrate how constructing workflows for reproducible analyses can serve as the next step from computational notebooks towards creating an analytical software.

item.title: How can big health data make an impact on health(care) system(s)?
item.description: Presenting a current example of how big data can improve mental health and augment surveillance in the province of B.C. through developing a framework for ‘messy’ transactional electronic health record (EHR) data from secondary and tertiary health services

item.title: Encounter Data of Vancouver Island Health Authority
item.description: Focusing on Mental Health and Substance Use services, the presentation demonstrates the use of Clinical Context Coding Scheme to analyze service utilization data of Island Health

item.title: Toolbox and Toolsets of Reproducible Research
item.description: The lecture introduces reproducible research and demonstrates digital self-publishing with RStudio and Git (Hub). The skills described and emphasized in this workflow include data manipulation, graph production, statistical modeling, and dynamic reporting. A series of four talks discusses each skill and gives examples of possible implementations in R.

item.title: Epidemic Modeling of the Onset of Social Activities (EMOSA Models)
item.description: Epidemic Models of the Onset of Social Activities (EMOSA Models) are applied to religious participation of emerging adults, evaluating whether such behaviour as attending church services a better explained by diffusive or contagious mechanisms of spread
